intro: Pouteria caimito var. strigosa, commonly known as the caimito or pitahaya, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and fragrant, white flowers. The fruit, which is typically oval-shaped, has a thick, leathery skin and is rich in nutrients, including vitamins and antioxidants. The plant thrives in humid, warm climates and is often cultivated for its edible fruit and ornamental value. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and agricultural contexts.
